titleStmt.title: The Sumerian king list -- a composite transliteration

publicationStmt.distributor: The Electronic Text Corpus of Sumerian Literature

address.addrLine: The Oriental Institute, University of Oxford, Pusey Lane, Oxford OX1 2LE, UK, email etcsl@orinst.ox.ac.uk, http://etcsl.orinst.ox.ac.uk

seriesStmt.p: The Electronic Text Corpus of Sumerian Literature aims to make accessible over 400 literary works composed in the Sumerian language in ancient Mesopotamia during the late third and early second millennia BC. The works are in Sumerian composite transliteration and English prose translation with bibliographical information on each composition.

body.note: In the following composite text, mss. are referred to by the sigla used by Vincente 1995; from those listed there, mss. Fi, Go, P6, and WB 62 were not used; if not specified by a note, numerical data come from ms. WB.

l.note: Cited in OB catalogue from Urim (U2), 0.2.04, line 25

body.note: In mss. P2+L2, P3+BT14, P5, lines 60-61 precede lines 57-59.

body.note: Mss. IB, S, Su1, Su3+Su4 list the 3rd and 4th dynasty of Kic of lines 224-231 and lines 244-258, respectively, as one dynasty; IB places Akcak after the 3rd/4th dynasty of Kic; S, Su1 place Akcak before the 3rd/4th dynasty of Kic.

Mss. P2+L2, L1+N1 and P4+Ha conclude with a summary of the post-diluvian dynasties; the composite text of lines 378-431 uses numerical data from each ms. but follows the wording of P2+L2 and L1+N1.
